dict.acceptation: 不幸的，倒霉的；不吉利的；不成功的；可惜的，可叹的；

sent.orig: He has been unfortunate in his pursuits, and unfortunate in his family.
sent.trans: 他在事业方面很不幸，在家庭方面也很不幸。

sent.orig: The very most unfortunate job-seeker is the person who's looking for jobs that don't exist.
sent.trans: 最不幸的求职者就是那些找市场上并不存在的工作的人。

sent.orig: A man without an education is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances deprived.
sent.trans: 没有受过教育的人是境况不佳的不幸牺牲品。

sent.orig: The unfortunate natives were left in the lurch.
sent.trans: 倒霉的当地人就在危险时被舍弃不顾了。

sent.orig: He said the continuing circumstances were unfortunate.
sent.trans: 他说那种持续性的情况真的很倒楣。
